summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 forwarding a Crime Stoppers tip (577-W20983) regarding a sexual assault report related to the Epstein case to the NYPD Vice Enforcement Division. The email stresses the anonymous nature of the tip and prohibits its inclusion in investigative files.

persons.name: Sergeant
persons.role: NYPD Detective Bureau Vice Enforcement Division Sergeant
persons.context: The email is forwarded to this NYPD sergeant in the Vice Enforcement Division, indicating they are a recipient of the sexual assault tip related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Detective
persons.role: NYPD Detective Bureau Vice Enforcement Division Detective
persons.context: The email is addressed to a detective in the NYPD Vice Enforcement Division, forwarding a Crime Stoppers tip about a sexual assault related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Crime Stoppers Tip 577-W20983 Filed
events.description: New York City Crime Stoppers receives an anonymous tip regarding a sexual assault related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Tip Forwarded to NYPD Vice Enforcement
events.description: The Crime Stoppers sexual assault tip (577-W20983) related to the Epstein case is forwarded via email to the NYPD Vice Enforcement Division.

keyFacts: An anonymous sexual assault tip (Crime Stoppers Tip 577-W20983) related to the Epstein case was filed on August 3, 2019.
The tip was forwarded to the NYPD Vice Enforcement Division on August 5, 2019.
The document stresses the tip and reporter's identity must be kept anonymous and the report must NOT be included in any investigative file, indicating a sensitive or protected source.
